Since his passing, no next of kin has come forward to claim the funds, as required by our banking guidelines. Despite extensive efforts, no relatives or heirs have been located. After the successful transfer, my colleagues and I will travel to your country to receive our share. We plan to use our portion to import computer accessories as part of a business investment.

Private telephone number
Fax number

Important Notice: This transaction must remain strictly confidential due to its sensitive nature. Please contact me promptly via telephone or fax at the number provided. Include your phone and fax numbers for seamless communication.

Central Bank of Nigeria

Subject: Request for Assistance with Fund Transfer and Investment

Dear Sir,

I hope this letter finds you well. With great humility and respect, I am reaching out to seek your assistance for my children and me in a matter of utmost importance.

I found your contact in my late husband's commercial address book and believe you to be a trustworthy and reliable person who will not intimidate or betray me after hearing my story. I am a native of KONOBO in the KEREMA district of Sierra Leone, and the wife of the late Dr. Mundi A. Kojo, who was tragically assassinated by rebel forces loyal to Major John Paul Koromah. My husband held the position of Director General of the National Gold and Diamond Mining Corporation of Sierra Leone, which made him a target during the civil unrest.

Before his assassination, my husband instructed me and our children, Ibrahim and Amina, to leave Sierra Leone immediately due to the escalating violence. With the help of a trusted friend, we managed to escape to Togo, bringing with us some valuables, including $25 million USD packed in two trunks. These funds are currently secured with a trust company in Togo, and arrangements have been made with a courier company to transport the funds to your country.

We are planning to leave Togo entirely for your country due to its stable political environment, which will allow us to invest this money securely for the future of my children. I kindly ask for your assistance in claiming the funds from the trust company’s branch in Europe and depositing them into your account for safe investment opportunities in your country.

For your help, we are prepared to offer you 20% of the total sum. However, due to surveillance by Sierra Leonean government agents, I advise you to conclude all dealings directly with my son, Ibrahim Kojo. You can contact him immediately at ibrahimkojo@caramail.com to proceed with retrieving the consignment and transferring the funds to your account.

Please provide your private fax and phone numbers for confidential discussions. I assure you there is no risk involved in this transaction.

Thank you for your understanding and support. May you remain blessed.

Sincerely,
Mrs. Anne Kojo
